snippet: Janet Yellen, President Obama’s pick to run the Federal Reserve, has backed aggressive steps to promote employment but shown only limited willingness to tolerate higher inflation.
abstract: Janet Yellen, Pres Obama's pick to run the Federal Reserve and its vice chair since 2010, is seen by Democrats as the best person to press Fed's stimulus campaign and to strengthen financial regulation; her confirmation would reinforce Fed's evolution from an institution run by market-wise bureaucrats focused on controlling inflation to one run by academics committed to a broader mission of steady growth and minimal unemployment.

byline.contributor: J.D. Morris contributed reporting from Berkeley, Calif., Catherine Rampell from San Francisco and Vivian Yee from New York. Kitty Bennett contributed research.

lead_paragraph: Janet Yellen, President Obama’s pick to run the Federal Reserve, has backed aggressive steps to promote employment but shown only limited willingness to tolerate higher inflation.

headline.main: Yellen’s Path From Liberal Theorist to Fed Voice for Jobs
headline.print_headline: Yellen’s Path From Academic Theorist to the Fed’s Voice for Jobs
